snippet: The Justice Department can help by speeding up audits of prisons and jails and fully complying with the Prison Rape Elimination Act.
abstract: Editorial warns the Justice Department has failed to certify nearly enough examiners to inspect thousands of prisons for compliance with the Prison Rape Elimination Act, signed into law 10 years ago; laments that sexual violence remains endemic behind bars and says trend will not change without strict accountability.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department can help by speeding up audits of prisons and jails and fully complying with the Prison Rape Elimination Act.
